lines.text: Know her? Sure, I knew her. I was never close enough to smell her perfume, but I knew her!
What you need is fresh air.
Yeah. Yeah, open the window, huh?
No, not here. Fresh air couldn't get in here with a permit.
You're parked in the 'No Parking.'

[drunk and distracted]
Hmmm?
Parked in the "No Parking!'
That's the story of my life. I'm always where I shouldn't be. I'm also not where I ought to be. Ever since Adam, Man's been crying, 'Where am I?'
Ha-ha, lieutenant, you're not young enough to start on this case.
Maybe, but I'm dumb enough.
Is your husband here?

[after a pause]
Not exactly.
Were you ever married?

[Another pause]
Not exactly. I... I, uh - you see, I...
If there's anything I can do...
I want a list of everything you sold and where you sold it.
Of course. Well, that is, if I can remember. My memory, you know, isn't exactly my number one asset.
Well, pull your assets together - I want the truth!

[to Dr. McAdoo]
Professors work with their heads. Cops work with their feet.

[taking offense when questioned]
You know, I'm used to respect! People looking up to me!
So am I Mr. Harkley, and my family hasn't been in this country for even one hundred years!
